'Ninguém fica velha, fica loira', brinca Luciana Gimenez
Apresentadora surgiu com novo visual no Baile da Bruxa
01 Nov 2019, 04:03 by Anahi Martinho

São Paulo

Luciana Gimenez chegou fanfarrona e loiríssima ao Baile da Bruxa, nesta quinta-feira (31), no Hotel Four Seasons, em São Paulo.
Sobre a nova cor de cabelo, a apresentadora brincou que “ninguém fica velha, fica loira”.
"Fui ao cabeleireiro, sempre quis ficar loira, aí pensei que ele ia fazer umas mechas, mas ele realmente achou que eu ia ficar bonita loira”, contou Luciana, 49.
Segundo a apresentadora do SuperPop (RedeTV!), o cabelo claro dá a impressão de deixar a pele mais pálida, além de trazer ressecamento aos fios. “Eu não aguento muito tempo, logo volto a ser morena”, confessou.
O filho caçula de Gimenez, Lorenzo Fragali, aprovou a mudança. Já o primogênito Lucas Jagger ainda não viu a mãe com os novos cabelos.

'Nobody gets old, gets blonde', jokes Luciana Gimenez
Presenter came up with a new look at Witch's Ball
01 Nov 2019, 04:03 by Anahi Martinho

Sao Paulo

Luciana Gimenez arrived at the Ball of the Witch, who was very fanatical and blonde, on Thursday (31), at the Four Seasons Hotel, in São Paulo.
About the new hair color, the host joked that "nobody gets old, gets blonde".
"I went to the hairdresser, I always wanted to go blonde, so I thought he was going to do some strands, but he really thought I was going to be pretty blonde," said Luciana, 49.
According to the host of SuperPop (RedeTV!), Light hair gives the impression of making the skin paler, as well as bringing dryness to the hair. “I can't stand it for a long time, and soon I'm dark again,” he confessed.
Gimenez's youngest son, Lorenzo Fragali, approved the move. Already the firstborn Lucas Jagger has not seen his mother with the new hair.
